Blizzard, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞºĞ»ÑÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒ Ğ¼ĞµĞ¶Ğ´Ñƒ 1-Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸ 2-Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑĞ¸ÑÑ… Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹, Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸)

Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾, ĞĞ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾

At it's heart it is a good game.

But it could be a better game with so many simple changes which is what hurts the most.

It is filled with so many questionable decisions, that all in turn have hurt the game little by little.

A: Ok, can you tell me a joke?
B: Overwatch 2
the only thing entertaining about blizzard entertainment is how thoroughly and efficiently they've ruined all of their IPs and community good will, and how they continue to sink further somehow.

Really bad - A breakdown.

I redownloaded this to write this review.

Overwatch(og) had issues, real, real issues. Effort from the development team was not one of them. They tried tirelessly to put forward a game where every hero was impactful, and more importantly, FUN TO PLAY. Some of the most fun heroes to play were consistently classed as "off-meta", but due to that, their impact on the lobby felt huge. Pharah, Roadhog, Mei, Wrecking Ball, Junkrat, Echo, Reaper, as great examples ALL WORKED AND WERE ALL FUN TO PLAY.

That is all gone in Overwatch 2. 

- Your "fun" hero specific role got replaced with diversity characters far stronger than you will ever be.
- Your impact on a lobby is none existent due to massively overwhelming metas. Arguably more overwhelming now than at any point in Overwatch 1 (which had 6x the lifespan). You play meta or you lose, there is no inbetween, which effectively makes 80% of the roster of heros a borderline throw-pick. Especially in the upper rankings.
- The best part of Overwatch 1 was tank synergising. They removed a tank, so that no longer exists.
- Due to no second tank, there is no backline peeling available (Zarya, DVA, Sigma, Hog) specialised in this aspect in Overwatch 1. Which lays directly into the Meta of full dive, all of the time.
- MMR is shared between competitive and quick play. So whilst learning a hero in quick play, you're actively tranking your personal MMR and the MMR of those around you.
- Automated ban system makes reporting people ridiculous. You can personally spam report 1 person 50 times and they will be banned for it. Even if they did nothing.

- The professional scene is just embarrassing. The entire 2 seasons of Overwatch League since release has been 1 meta and 1 meta only. Monkey, Tracer, Sombra with Ana and Brig (As they're the only backline heros that have survivability options vs Dive).

- They replaced 2CP maps (Volskaya, Hanamura, Anubis), which had MASSIVE POTENTIAL TO BE REWORKED TO MAKE 2CP actually rewarding to play. And just flat removed them for a game mode in Push which is universally hated. With even professional players calling the game mode a "chore", and "far too skewed towards hyper mobility". This game mode is forced down your throat endlessly.


- Blizzards legal issues have spewed over into the game. Forcing people that play games, to be involved in the ridiculous politics that they play games to avoid. It has spewed out into movies (why not ask Disney how that is going for them?), and now it's here in Overwatch, too, with similar results. Diversity characters have been massively panned by the playerbase. Forced political agenda to mask Blizzard's pathetic real life situations, have forced a playerbase that just want to be left the hell alone, to play a part in Blizzard's law suits and real life. This is a game, it is not real life.


PvE being canned was the last straw. PvE was the only addition in Overwatch 2 that had potential. Everything else that they "added", was massively unwanted before they even released. 

They actively took away more than they added going into Overwatch 2. Overwatch(og) was bigger, better, had far superior development, less bugs, better balance and tried to make it fun for the playerbase, instead of treating their players as walking cash machines. That's all Overwatch 2 is. It's a scam masquerading as a game, to make you spend money.. Even on things that you already unlocked in Overwatch 1.

It really, really does beg the question,
WHAT THE HELL WERE THEY CODING FOR THREE F****** YEARS GOING INTO THIS GAME? Because it sure as hell wasn't this garbage.

Do not play this game.
Buys DLC, doesn't work, not eligible for refund. Cool
Overwatch 2 is a critically acclaimed, team-based shooter game set in an optimistic future with an evolving roster of heroes. Team up with friends and jump in today.

This isn't even Overwatch 2 it's more like Overwatch 1.5. I literally opened the game just get achievements and to see how bad the new hero is.

Pro's:
- Can play with friends

Cons:
- Took away 6 v 6
- Battle-pass sucks more than your average Only Fans creator
- Took away the ability to earn points consistently
- Character Buffs & Nerf don't make sense
- Very little cared for
- Authentication tool is trash
- Developers neglect community like a father to his unwanted child
- Took away Medals
- Ranked mode not as rewarding anymore
- Nearly everything locked behind a paywall

If you actively play this game I'm very sorry. You'll have a more enjoyable time playing cool math games

i have much more hours on battle.net. my max rank was diamond healer.
actual gameplay review in second paragraph.

fun game with terrible developers.
they lied about a pve mode, and then released overwatch 2 after a long delay with no changes to the real game, with free to play and new monetization that is ridiculous.
they consistently add new characters that break the game and then nerf them after a while to uselessness. 
they do not value their community.


GAMEPLAY REVIEW:
the core gameplay of overwatch is fun. you will not find casual fun here, as it shares the same virus league of legends does.
even in unranked, you feel driven to play competetively, as that is the vibe of the game.
a significant amount of aiming combined with tactical usage of abilities and ultimates provides a team versus team competetive experience no other hero shooter has properly nailed before.
the community is extremely toxic, and even if you perform well people will blame you for their faults.

overall, it is a good game, with few faults to the core gameplay formula, as well as being free to play. with these concepts in mind i reccommend playing it. however, the negative reviews are not just review bombs and have truth to them.

As a former player, overwatch was okay before its transformation: afterwards it was changed into some f2p abomination, spat on EA's face with their tremendous prices and very poor 'freemium' excuses. Everything good was either changed, removed or silenced by other needless substantial changes. Meanwhile tf2's been thriving for 16 years now, hitting player peaks every half a year now and has something overwatch will never posess: a giant undying community of players, that make it special (although it's NOT perfect by any means). Not to mention, everything, and i mean EVERYTHING altering your experience in-game can be bought for as much as 1$ (the MvM ticket, later sold for refined metal, with which all weaponry can be bought), and even after, you'll remain with 95% of its value left to be either spent on stuff like stranges, hats, etc. or converted back to money. Conclusion: the supposed killer slipped on its own shit and accidentally stabbed self in the heart.

And yes, I had downloaded the game and waited for 20 minutes just to post this.

PS https://store.steampowered.com/app/440

I used to love the absolute hell out of Overwatch back in 2017, but those times are long gone.
Honestly, I'm not sure who this game is for anymore.

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

there is nothing you can do in the game, everything is the same but you can spend more time and more fun watching overwatch porn

I have played Overwatch for the past 7 years, it has been a HUGE part of my life. I started on Xbox and then swapped to PC when I got an Esports scholarship for college. After I swapped to PC I grinded the game even more to get back to GM on my PC account so I could compete in Collegiate Overwatch... then OW2 came out... With that they ruined the ranked system (SR inflation), player progression system (borders), events and worst of all we were not given what we were promised over the 3 year content drought... PVE. The store and cosmetic system is a joke. It will cost your left ball and a kidney in order to buy a Kiriko skin. They even took out the best part about events which was grinding the game to get skins. Events are a shell of what they once were and are now an excuse for Blizzard to come and take our money like a 1764 tax collector. The balance has been HORRIBLE especially for supports and tanks. On top of all of this the game is buggy as hell and comes with a fresh set of bugs every update. As someone who has lived and breathed this game for YEARS I can say I am beyond disappointed with the game and I have jumped ship for Valorant. I suggest everyone who still wastes their time on this game to do the same. Fuck Activision Blizzard.
